thread.title: Alexis Sanchez sparks Arsenal exit fears after throwing tantrum following Bournemouth draw
thread.title_full: Alexis Sanchez sparks Arsenal exit fears after throwing tantrum following Bournemouth draw

author: jgordon
title: Alexis Sanchez sparks Arsenal exit fears after throwing tantrum following Bournemouth draw
text:
SANCHEZ FURY Alexis Sanchez sparks Arsenal exit fears after throwing tantrum following Bournemouth draw 
Chilean forward grew increasingly frustrated and clashed with Aaron Ramsey to leave team-mates concerned he will quit By ALEC SHILTON ARSENAL fear Alexis Sanchez could be set for the exit after his tantrum at Bournemouth. 
Sanchez was furious with Tuesday’s 3-3 draw — despite his side’s’ three-goal comeback. Reuters Alexis Sanchez could not hide his frustration at seeing two points wasted Reuters 5 Chilean forward scored a diving header to trigger a comeback from three goals down 
And it is believed he carried his rage into the dressing room, leaving stunned team-mates fearing his mind is made up over his future. 
It is thought he ignored the rest of the Gunners players at full-time, furious they had celebrated a draw in a game they ought to be winning. 
Arsenal stars Alexis Sanchez and Aaron Ramsey are at war, says Highbury hero Stewart Robson GLOVE HATE RELATIONSHIP Furious Alexis Sanchez hurled his gloves to the floor in disgust at final whistle... after an earlier row with Aaron Ramsey Who's next? Alexis Sanchez, Zlatan Ibrahimovic, John Terry... Who will be next Prem star to join Chinese revolution? PINCH OF SANCH Arsenal will be desperate for their Chilean superstar to sign a new deal as Juventus wait to pounce WENG: WONGA'S WRONG Arsene Wenger adamant he's not interested in China switch... and neither is Alexis Sanchez 
Arsenal fans had sung “this is embarrassing”, as Charlie Daniels, Callum Wilson and Ryan Fraser left their side 3-0 down. 
But Sanchez and Lucas Perez gave Arsene Wenger’s outfit hope before Olivier Giroud’s leveller led to his celebratory jig. 
Sanchez, 28, is yet to sign an extension to his current deal, which is set to expire in 18 months’ time. Reuters Alexis Sanchez and Aaron Ramsey do not get on according to former Arsenal midfielder Stewart Robson Sky Sports Arsenal’s top scorer chucked away his gloves as his anger boiled over 
Manchester City and Chelsea are monitoring the situation. 
As revealed by SunSport, the forward is also targeted by Chinese Super League club Hebei China Fortune — managed by ex-City boss Manuel Pellegrini — where he could earn a staggering £500,000 a week. Sanchez was still clearly fuming after Arsenal had fought back from three goals down to draw 3-3 at Bournemouth Bournemouth 3 Arsenal 3: Olivier Giroud scores injury-time equaliser
